name: CommandBuilder
description:
The `CommandBuilder` class is a powerful builder-based API in JSMacros that allows you to create and register custom Minecraft commands with complex argument parsing and execution logic. It wraps Minecraft's Brigadier command system and provides a fluent interface for defining command structure, arguments, suggestions, and execution callbacks.

This class is the primary way to create custom commands that can be executed through Minecraft's chat interface, providing access to argument types like numbers, strings, items, blocks, positions, and more.
overview:
The `CommandBuilder` uses a builder pattern to construct commands step by step. You define the command structure by adding arguments, setting up suggestions, defining execution logic, and finally registering the command with the game.

Key Features:
- Comprehensive argument type support (numbers, strings, items, blocks, positions, NBT, etc.)
- Custom argument suggestions and auto-completion
- Regular expression argument parsing
- Command branching with logical alternatives
- Integration with JSMacros event system
- Thread-safe execution with proper locking

methods.name: literalArg
methods.description: Adds a literal argument that must match the exact string provided. Literals are used for command keywords and subcommands.

methods.name: or
methods.description: Creates an alternative branch in the command structure. This allows multiple command patterns to execute the same command.

methods.name: otherwise
methods.description: Alias for `or()` to work around JavaScript language restrictions where "or" might be a reserved word in some contexts.

methods.name: or
methods.description: Creates an alternative branch starting from a specific argument level in the command tree.

parameters.name: argumentLevel
parameters.description: The argument level to branch from

methods.name: otherwise
methods.description: Alias for `or(argumentLevel)` to work around JavaScript language restrictions.

parameters.name: argumentLevel
parameters.description: The argument level to branch from

methods.name: booleanArg
methods.description: Adds a boolean argument that accepts true/false values.

methods.name: intArg
methods.description: Adds an integer argument without range restrictions.

methods.name: intArg
methods.description: Adds an integer argument with value range validation.

methods.name: longArg
methods.description: Adds a long integer argument without range restrictions.

methods.name: longArg
methods.description: Adds a long integer argument with value range validation.

methods.name: doubleArg
methods.description: Adds a double-precision floating point argument without range restrictions.

methods.name: doubleArg
methods.description: Adds a double-precision floating point argument with value range validation.

methods.name: floatRangeArg
methods.description: Adds a float range argument (accepts ranges like "1.0..5.5").

methods.name: intRangeArg
methods.description: Adds an integer range argument (accepts ranges like "1..5").

methods.name: wordArg
methods.description: Adds a word argument that accepts a single word without spaces.

methods.name: quotedStringArg
methods.description: Adds a string argument that can contain spaces if enclosed in quotes.

methods.name: greedyStringArg
methods.description: Adds a greedy string argument that consumes all remaining input including spaces. This is typically used as the last argument in a command.

methods.name: regexArgType
methods.description: Adds a custom regex argument that validates input against a regular expression pattern. Returns an array of matched groups.

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: Regex flags ("i" for case-insensitive, "s" for dotall, "u" for unicode)

methods.name: itemArg
methods.description: Adds an item argument that accepts Minecraft item identifiers.

methods.name: itemStackArg
methods.description: Adds an item argument that accepts Minecraft item identifiers.

methods.name: itemPredicateArg
methods.description: Adds an item predicate argument that accepts item filters and selectors.

methods.name: blockArg
methods.description: Adds a block argument that accepts Minecraft block identifiers.

methods.name: blockStateArg
methods.description: Adds a block argument that accepts Minecraft block identifiers.

methods.name: blockPredicateArg
methods.description: Adds a block predicate argument that accepts block filters and selectors.

methods.name: blockPosArg
methods.description: Adds a block position argument that accepts x, y, z coordinates (supports relative coordinates with ~ and ^).

methods.name: columnPosArg
methods.description: Adds a column position argument that accepts x, z coordinates (ignores y coordinate).

methods.name: dimensionArg
methods.description: Adds a dimension argument that accepts dimension identifiers (overworld, nether, end).

methods.name: identifierArg
methods.description: Adds a general identifier argument that accepts Minecraft-style resource identifiers (namespace:path).

methods.name: nbtArg
methods.description: Adds an NBT compound argument that accepts NBT data in JSON format.

methods.name: nbtCompoundArg
methods.description: Adds an NBT compound argument that accepts NBT data in JSON format.

methods.name: nbtElementArg
methods.description: Adds an NBT element argument that accepts any NBT data type.

methods.name: colorArg
methods.description: Adds a color argument that accepts color names or hex values.

methods.name: timeArg
methods.description: Adds a time argument that accepts time values (like "1d", "2h", "30m").

methods.name: angleArg
methods.description: Adds an angle argument that accepts rotation values.

methods.name: uuidArgType
methods.description: Adds a UUID argument that accepts universally unique identifiers.

methods.name: textArgType
methods.description: Adds a text argument that accepts JSON text components.

methods.name: particleArg
methods.description: Adds a particle argument that accepts particle effect identifiers.

methods.name: itemSlotArg
methods.description: Adds an item slot argument that accepts inventory slot identifiers.

methods.name: suggestMatching
methods.description: Adds tab completion suggestions that must match exactly.

methods.name: suggestMatching
methods.description: Overload that accepts a Collection instead of an array.

methods.name: suggestIdentifier
methods.description: Adds tab completion suggestions for identifiers (with namespace validation).

methods.name: suggestIdentifier
methods.description: Overload that accepts a Collection instead of an array.

methods.name: suggestPositions
methods.description: Adds tab completion suggestions for block positions.

parameters.name: suggestions
parameters.description: Array of position strings ("x y z")

methods.name: suggestPositions
methods.description: Overload that accepts a Collection instead of an array.

methods.name: suggestBlockPositions
methods.description: Adds tab completion suggestions using BlockPosHelper objects.

methods.name: suggestBlockPositions
methods.description: Overload that accepts a Collection instead of an array.

methods.name: suggest
methods.description: Adds custom dynamic suggestions using a callback function.

methods.name: executes
methods.description:
Sets the execution callback for the command. The callback receives a `CommandContextHelper` object containing the parsed arguments.

Important Notes:
- The callback must return `true` for success or `false` for failure
- For complex operations with waits, use `JsMacros.runScript()` and pass the context as the event
- The `CommandContextHelper` extends `BaseEvent`, so it can be passed directly to JSMacros functions
- Execution is thread-safe with proper locking mechanisms

methods.name: register
methods.description: Registers the command with Minecraft's command system, making it available for use.

methods.name: unregister
methods.description: Removes the command from Minecraft's command system.
examples:
// Later, to remove the command
command.unregister();
